intro: Rhinacanthus scoparius, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant red, trumpet-shaped flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus species. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers are typically pollinated by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
